intro: Sphaeranthus mimetes, commonly known as the mimic daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that resemble those of other species, a trait that likely aids in pollination. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are typically pink or white. Sphaeranthus mimetes is an annual herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
